availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Beriah Magoffin: Governor's Official Correspondence File, Petitions for Pardons and Remissions, 1859-1862

body.p:
The State of Indiana
County of Harrison } SS.

John F. Cunningham, Sheriff of said County of Harrison, makes oath and says that Samuel Allen, late of said County, against whom an indictment for assault and battery with intent to murder has been presented in the Harrison Circuit Court in said State of Indiana, is absent from said State, and is in a boat at Cedar Branch, Meade County, Kentucky, as affiant is informed and believes.

The State of Indiana
County of Harrison } SS.

I, David M. Jones, Clerk, of the Harrison Circuit Court, hereby certify that on this the 10th day of June, A. D. 1862, at my office in Corydon the above names John F. Cunningham personally appeared before me as Clerk aforesaid, duly authorized by law to administer oaths, and made oath, in due form of law, to the foregoing affidant.
Witness, David M. Jones, Clerk and the seal of said Court at Corydon on this 10th day of June A. D. 1862.

David M. Jones Clk
Har. Cir. Court
